    smargins Questions and Discussion

    2017-11-30

    Specify x variable names or values?

    Given the following model:

    m <- lm(mpg ~ hp + wt, data = mtcars)

    suppose that we wish to examine the effect of hp by calculating expected values at several levels of hp while averaging over the observed values of wt.

    Which do you like better?

    smargins_v1(m, hp = quantile(hp))
    ##       hp .sim_number .smargin_qi
## 1     52           1    23.43415
## 2     52           2    22.06762
## 3     52           3    21.93736
## 4     52           4    20.79450
## 5     52           5    22.91710
## 6     52           6    22.57741
## # - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -                                 
## 24995 335        4995    16.44750
## 24996 335        4996    12.72099
## 24997 335        4997    14.28981
## 24998 335        4998    13.01697
## 24999 335        4999    12.82070
## 25000 335        5000    16.61789

    or

    smargins_v2(m, "hp")
    ##       hp .sim_number .smargin_qi
## 1     52           1    22.00846
## 2     52           2    23.29410
## 3     52           3    22.47808
## 4     52           4    21.68294
## 5     52           5    21.58904
## 6     52           6    22.26535
## # - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -                                 
## 24995 335        4995    13.03139
## 24996 335        4996    16.04784
## 24997 335        4997    13.13492
## 24998 335        4998    12.69117
## 24999 335        4999    12.44544
## 25000 335        5000    10.45215

    ?

    Now suppose that we want to choose the values of hp ourselves:

    smargins_v1(m, hp = seq(50, 350, by = 50))
    ##       hp .sim_number .smargin_qi
## 1     50           1    24.04149
## 2     50           2    22.48656
## 3     50           3    25.43862
## 4     50           4    23.65238
## 5     50           5    22.86388
## 6     50           6    21.95825
## # - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -                                 
## 34995 350        4995    12.79141
## 34996 350        4996    15.22682
## 34997 350        4997    14.75734
## 34998 350        4998    15.97615
## 34999 350        4999    12.12507
## 35000 350        5000    13.29887

    or

    smargins_v2(m, "hp", xvalues = list(hp = seq(50, 350, by = 50)))
    ##       hp .sim_number .smargin_qi
## 1     50           1    24.55306
## 2     50           2    21.56957
## 3     50           3    23.36404
## 4     50           4    21.78855
## 5     50           5    23.38039
## 6     50           6    22.60272
## # - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -                                 
## 34995 350        4995    11.07827
## 34996 350        4996    14.36518
## 34997 350        4997    15.10669
## 34998 350        4998    13.68474
## 34999 350        4999    12.83843
## 35000 350        5000    13.69062

    Now which do you prefer?

    smargins_v1 is more verbose for the simple case, but less so when the user does wish to specify values. Which one should we pick? Or is there some combination or alternative that would be even better?

    Interface for comparisons

    Some options:

    • matrix based, like car::lht, and https://github.com/goshevs/effcomp
    • character representation, like car::lht
    • function based, like emmeans::contrast
    • function based, but function does computation directly

    • Interface for comparisons
